data.title: Preferences implementation for iOS backend
data.body: It uses a NSMutableDictionary read and write from/to in Library/${preferencesName}.plist.  The IOSPreferences.get() : Map<String, ?> is returning a map<string,string> for now since we can't know the type of the saved values when converting. Other implementations/suggestions are welcome for this special case.

data.title: OrthographicCamera "fix"
data.body: I can't reproduce any problems without this changes, but i think it's right.

data.title: Added postRunnables implementation for iOS backend
data.body: Implemented postRunnable to add a runnable to runnables and added a new method processRunnables, similar to LwjglApplication runnables process, called in OnUpdateFrame() from IOSGraphics (iPhoneOSGameView)

data.title: iOS: retina support + option to disable screen dimming
data.body:
Changes:
1. retina support 
2. screen dimming

I updated the configuration options so retina coordinates can be used :-)   Playing around with it, it turned out to scale the screen to something else than 2.0 on retina devices works extremely well. No artifacts at all (even bitmap fonts looks smooth)! 2.0 is actually pretty tiny, so instead you can use something like 1.75 to match let's say the 800x480 screens on Android! I borrowed my niece's iPod for testing.

I hope I am making sense. Not sure how to name those variables. Feel free to suggest better names. Also wonder how easy it would be to scale non-retina devices?

data.title: Added .mtl loader to ObjLoader
data.body: adds support to load .mtl material files (diffuse+specular colors +texture)

data.title: Bullet, added mesh shaped bodies, raycastvehicle and a simple test
data.body:
This adds mesh shaped bodies and raycastvehicle support.

I also added a simple test to show the usage, it requires the libraries to be compiled for it to work.

data.title: Add hide status bar buttons feature for Android 4.x
iOS: improved disposal of Sound/Music (very minor)
Deprecated Android SDK constant
data.body: SDK_INT available since API 4 (Android 1.6), so, it's not a problem for compatibility (as i know libgdx is not support android less than 1.6)

data.title: Duplicate code in OrthographicCamera#update
data.body: Calling OrthographicCamera#update(void) is equal to calling OrthographicCamera#update(true).

data.title: Added a list created by using tables.
BitmapFont(), lineHeight should be scaled across the y-axis.
Fix for issue 1045
data.body: Modified AtlasRegion.flip(x,y) to use packedWidth, packedHeight depending on the rotate value to fix the issue 1045, tested with the same test attached at the issue page: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=1045 and also with https://github.com/gemserk/libgdx-tests. Even though, there could be errors, so maybe someone can re validate it before applying the pull request.

data.title: Fixed infinite loop in GWTApplication postRunnable
data.body: GWTApplication fell into an infinite loop whenever postRunnable was called from a Runnable (the runnable queue never ended)

data.title: IOSSound updated (played outside rendering loop now => smoother frame rate).
data.body: ...oother frame rate (little bit of a hack). Some info output converted to Gdx.app.debug(…) => seemed more suitable.

data.title: Added support for opening URLs.
data.body: I added an `openURI` method to `Net` which will open supplied URLs in the default browser (or whichever application is registered with the scheme). It's implemented for all backends, although I don't have a mac to test the ios one.

data.title: Added support for float textures
data.body: It can be handy if one needs more precision in shaders.

data.title: Added setAngle(float) to Vector2
data.body: Added setAngle(float) to Vector2

data.title: Added some minor math functions to vector2/3 and updated gitignore
data.body:
Hey!

I love libgdx, so I thought I'd contribute something simple back to the library. Hope this is useful. Let me know if I screwed something up.

Commit msg:
- added div and mul methods to vectors
- updated gitignore to ignore target directories

data.title: Socket implementation for iOS backend
data.body: Haven't tested it yet, but here's the socket implementation for iOS over C# sockets.

data.title: Avoid unnecesary calls to renderMesh() in both enableBlending and disableBlending if blending was already enabled/disabled.
data.body:
The commit log says the idea:

"modified SpriteBatch enableBlending() and disableBlending() methods to check if blendingDisabled was disabled or enabled, respectively, to perform the renderMesh() or not, so two consecutive calls to enableBlending/disableBlending will not perform a renderMesh() call"

data.title: Allow building gdx2d.c without JNI
data.body:
This appeared to already be intended, because of this in the original:
# ifdef NOJNI
# define JNIEXPORT
# endif

data.title: Stop LwjglApplication when not running
data.body:
Just a modification inside the main loop, if running is false after the runnables were processed then the while should stop. In some cases, if the loop is not stopped it could lead to errors since the application could be in a non stable state.

The commit is mainly a suggestion, could be implemented in other nicer ways.

data.title: gdx.net for Android implemented (sockets)
data.body:
Changes:
- Android backend implemented (copy from LWJGL)
- ServerHints.backlog documentation updated

I'll try to get started with the iOS backend this week (no promises :-)

data.title: gdx.net: first set of changes!
data.body:
Here are my first set of changes for cross-platform networking on libgdx. I implemented the socket connection functionality over java.net.*. 

Request for feedback:

1) not sure about naming all those hint variables. I wonder what Mono uses? My naming matches what Java offers though but they seem quite inconsistent with the TCP specs. Sometimes following the TCP specs naming convention, other times not? Sometimes it's called "soTimeout", sometimes just "timeout". Anyhow, I followed the Java naming, the only thing I didn't follow was the soTimeout (server hints). I think calling it "acceptTimeout" is a lot clearer? 

2) I implemented the classes for the LWJGL backend. This will be the exact same for Android. How would I go about that without producing duplicate code? 

3) we should add a newServerSocket/newClientSocket without the hints? No hints meaning to use the platform defaults. I already check if hints if null and if it is null it will simply use the defaults on the platform.

4) not sure what "backlog" means (server hints)?

Please note I haven't tested it at all (sorry, didn't have time yet). It should compile just fine. Not sure if you should merge it just yet? I am mainly posting it to gather some feedback.

data.title: Added support for right/bottom edge fill lines in .9.png files.
data.body:
- Modified TexturePacker2 to include padding values in atlases.
- Modified TextureAtlas and Skin to load said values and pass them on to NinePatches built from them.
- Modified NinePatch to store padding values, as well asprovide getters/setters.
- Modified NinePatchDrawable to use these values.
- Modified default-round.9.png to include bottom/right fill values as test.  This can be seen in the UITest.  Note the Yes/No buttons on the "Are you enjoying this demo?" dialog and the multi-line button now allow the text to fill closer to the top and bottom, pushing out the left/right edges to avoid text overlapping rounded corners.
- Also tested this in my own game, though obviously that's not included in this CL.  :)

data.title: iOS Bugfixes (minor)
data.body: Just a few bugfixes for iOS (didn't have time for more). Encountered while testing Tropical Stormfront...

data.title: Again some (hopefully) useful methods for AssetManager
data.body:
- method to get the type of an asset
- method to get an asset without the type parameter
